definition: to pass on a story/to communicate a message
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.english: You can leave a message now.
O:I'll connect you with the Message Desk.Just a moment,please.
sentences.chinese: 我帮您接通传话柜台，请稍等。

sentences.english: This hides the rest of the file system from remote sessions.
sentences.chinese: 这样就可以向远程传话隐藏文件系统的其他部分。

sentences.english: And take a message hoping to hear YangGuang play a xiao song.
sentences.chinese: 并且传话希望听到杨广吹奏一首萧曲。

sentences.english: Nope,she is out, can I take a message?
sentences.chinese: 不在，她出去了，要我传话吗？

definition: to send word/to deliver a letter
to take a letter/to send word
to intercede/to plead for sb else
to introduce (sb)/(esp.) to present to the emperor
call in (one's subordinates)/summon (an envoy of a foreign country) to an interview
to make inquiries/to try to find out/to pry
